import MethodEndpoint from "@theme/ApiExplorer/MethodEndpoint";
import ParamsDetails from "@theme/ParamsDetails";

<Heading
  as={"h1"}
  className={"openapi__heading"}
  children={"Assign SLA to ticket"}
>
</Heading>

<MethodEndpoint
  method={"post"}
  path={"/api/v1.0/tickets/{ticketId}/sla"}
  context={"endpoint"}
>
  
</MethodEndpoint>



Assigns a Service Level Agreement (SLA) to a ticket. The SLA defines response time and resolution time targets for the ticket.

**Prerequisites**
1. **ticketId** – Use [POST /api/v1.0/tickets](/docs/api/tickets/search-tickets) to find the ticket and extract `Items[].TicketId`.
2. **SlaId** – Use [GET /api/v1.0/slas](/docs/api/slas/list-slas) to list available SLAs and extract `Items[].SlaId`.

**Workflow Example**
1. Search for the ticket: [POST /api/v1.0/tickets](/docs/api/tickets/search-tickets) with appropriate filters.
2. List available SLAs: [GET /api/v1.0/slas](/docs/api/slas/list-slas) to find the appropriate SLA for the ticket type.
3. Assign the SLA: POST /api/v1.0/tickets/\{ticketId\}/sla with the selected `SlaId`.
4. Verify assignment: [GET /api/v1.0/tickets/\{ticketId\}/sla](/docs/api/tickets/get-ticket-sla) to confirm the SLA timers are now active.

**Minimal Required Fields**: SlaId

<Heading
  id={"request"}
  as={"h2"}
  className={"openapi-tabs__heading"}
  children={"Request"}
>
</Heading>

<ParamsDetails
  parameters={[{"name":"ticketId","in":"path","required":true,"description":"UUID of the ticket to assign the SLA to. Obtain via POST /api/v1.0/tickets and read `Items[].TicketId`.","example":"0466a7fd-6dab-ef11-88cf-6045bdb6b1c8","x-obtained-from":{"operationId":"searchTickets","endpoint":"POST /api/v1.0/tickets","responseField":"Items[].TicketId"},"schema":{"type":"string","format":"uuid"}}]}
>
  
</ParamsDetails>

<RequestSchema
  title={"Body"}
  body={{"required":true,"description":"SLA to assign to the ticket. Only the SlaId field is required.","content":{"application/json":{"schema":{"type":"object","description":"Request payload for assigning an SLA to a single ticket. The C# endpoint accepts the full Sla model but only uses the SlaId property.","properties":{"SlaId":{"type":"string","format":"uuid","description":"Identifier of the SLA to assign to the ticket. Obtain via GET /api/v1.0/slas and extract `Items[].SlaId`.","x-obtained-from":{"operationId":"listSlas","endpoint":"GET /api/v1.0/slas","responseField":"Items[].SlaId"},"example":"33e9f623-68cd-4b69-8cc5-635d4b6e6841"}},"required":["SlaId"],"example":{"SlaId":"33e9f623-68cd-4b69-8cc5-635d4b6e6841"},"title":"SlaAssignRequest"},"example":{"SlaId":"33e9f623-68cd-4b69-8cc5-635d4b6e6841"}}}}}
>
  
</RequestSchema>
